data.title: Michael Douglas Reveals Catherine Zeta-Jones Makes Him "Whip It Out"
data.meta_description: Michael Douglas revealed that wife Catherine Zeta-Jones makes him "drop the trou and whip it out" on the golf course when he loses to her.
data.text:
Originally appeared on E! Online

It appears that Michael Douglas and Catherine Zeta-Jones take their war of the losers very seriously.

The Romancing the Stone star—who will be celebrating 25 years of marriage with the Chicago actress next year—revealed some very NSFW information to prove just how competitive his wife can be when the duo are on the golf course. So, what does Catherine make him do if he happens to lose?

"Whip it out," Michael told the shocked hosts of The View July 10. "She says, 'You've gotta whip it out.'"

The War of the Roses actor couldn't help but laugh as he added, "Drop the trou and whip it out."

Host Alyssa Farah Griffin—who was stunned by the revelation—cracked, "That's the secret to a marriage."

But Michael did add that hopefully he won't be dropping his pants anytime soon.

"I'm going to be 80 in September," he continued, "so now I play off of ladies tees, too, so I don't have to do that anymore."

More from E! Online

TikToker Bella Brave, 10, Placed in a Medically Induced Coma

MTV Reveals Chanel West Coast's Ridiculousness Replacement

BBC Journalist’s Family Tragedy: Police Call Crossbow Murder a "Targeted" Attack

Michael and Catherine—who share son Dylan, 23, and daughter Carys, 21—have had quite the love story since they first connected in France in 1998. In fact, Michael, who is also father to son Cameron, 45 with his ex Diandra Luker, told Entertainment Tonight in 2016 his favorite showbiz moment was when he met her, which, according to Catherine, Michael facilitated after he saw her in 1998's The Mask of Zorro.

"Michael was there promoting A Perfect Murder, and he asked to meet me," she told The New Yorker in 2016. "I remember I walked through the door of the hotel when I arrived, and he walked right past me with his golf bag on his shoulder. I went, 'OK, guess he really wants to meet me—he just walked right past me.'"

And while the 54-year-old admits she wasn't interested in him at the time, she did appreciate his persistence after that first encounter, especially when he managed to send her a bouquet of flowers with a note that read, "I'm sorry if I scared you. Love, Michael Douglas."

"I will say if somebody says they're going to father your children when you've just met them," she explained, "it is a little scary. Unfortunately he was right, again."

Curious about more wild celebrity confessions? Keep reading.
